verses.verse: Now Jethro<WH3503>, the priest<WH3548> of Midian<WH4080>, Moses<WH4872>' father-in<WH2859>-law, heard<WH8085> of all that God<WH430> had done<WH6213> for Moses<WH4872>, and for Israel<WH3478> his people<WH5971>, how that Jehovah<WH3068> had brought<WH3318> Israel<WH3478> out of Egypt<WH4714>.
And Jethro<WH3503>, Moses<WH4872>' father-in<WH2859>-law, took<WH3947> Zipporah<WH6855>, Moses<WH4872>' wife<WH802>, after<WH310> he had sent her away<WH7964>,
and her two<WH8147> sons<WH1121>; of whom the name<WH8034> of the one<WH259> was Gershom<WH1647>; for he said<WH559>, I have been a sojourner<WH1616> in a foreign<WH5237> land<WH776>:
and the name<WH8034> of the other<WH259> was Eliezer<WH461>; for he said<WH430>, The God of my father<WH1> was my help<WH5828>, and delivered<WH5337> me from the sword<WH2719> of Pharaoh<WH6547>.

And Jethro<WH3503>, Moses<WH4872>' father-in<WH2859>-law, came<WH935> with his sons<WH1121> and his wife<WH802> unto Moses<WH4872> into the wilderness<WH4057> where he was encamped<WH2583>, at the mount<WH2022> of God<WH430>:
and he said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, I<WH2859>, thy father-in-law Jethro<WH3503>, am come<WH935> unto thee<WH802>, and thy wife, and her two<WH8147> sons with her<WH1121>.

And Moses<WH4872> went out<WH3318> to meet<WH7125> his father-in<WH2859>-law, and did obeisance<WH7812>, and kissed<WH5401> him<WH7592>; and they asked each<WH376> other<WH7453> of their welfare<WH7965>; and they came<WH935> into the tent<WH168>.

And Moses<WH4872> told<WH5608> his father-in<WH2859>-law all that Jehovah<WH3068> had done<WH6213> unto Pharaoh<WH6547> and to the Egyptians<WH4714> for Israel<WH3478>'s sake<WH182>, all the travail<WH8513> that had come<WH4672> upon them by the way<WH1870>, and how Jehovah<WH3068> delivered them<WH5337>.

And Jethro<WH3503> rejoiced<WH2302> for all the goodness<WH2896> which Jehovah<WH3068> had done<WH6213> to Israel<WH3478>, in that he had delivered<WH5337> them out of the hand<WH3027> of the Egyptians<WH4714>.

And Jethro<WH3503> said<WH559>, Blessed<WH1288> be Jehovah<WH3068>, who hath delivered<WH5337> you out of the hand<WH3027> of the Egyptians<WH4714>, and out of the hand<WH3027> of Pharaoh<WH6547>; who hath delivered<WH5337> the people<WH5971> from under the hand<WH3027> of the Egyptians<WH4714>.
Now I know<WH3045> that Jehovah<WH3068> is greater<WH1419> than all gods<WH430>; yea<WH1697>, in the thing wherein they dealt proudly against them<WH2102>.

And Jethro<WH3503>, Moses<WH4872>' father-in<WH2859>-law, took<WH3947> a burnt-offering<WH5930> and sacrifices<WH2077> for God<WH430>: and Aaron<WH175> came<WH935>, and all the elders<WH2205> of Israel<WH3478>, to eat<WH398> bread<WH3899> with Moses<WH4872>' father-in<WH2859>-law before<WH6440> God<WH430>.

And it came to pass on the morrow<WH4283>, that Moses<WH4872> sat<WH3427> to judge<WH8199> the people<WH5971>: and the people<WH5971> stood<WH5975> about Moses<WH4872> from the morning<WH1242> unto the evening<WH6153>.

And when Moses<WH4872>' father-in<WH2859>-law saw<WH7200> all that he did<WH6213> to the people<WH5971>, he said<WH559>, What is this thing<WH1697> that thou doest<WH6213> to the people<WH5971>? why sittest<WH3427> thou thyself alone<WH5971>, and all the people stand<WH5324> about thee from morning<WH1242> unto even<WH6153>?
And Moses<WH4872> said<WH559> unto his father-in<WH2859>-law, Because the people<WH5971> come<WH935> unto me to inquire<WH1875> of God<WH430>:

when they have a matter<WH1697>, they come<WH935> unto me<WH8199>; and I judge between a man<WH376> and his neighbor<WH7453>, and I make them know<WH3045> the statutes<WH2706> of God<WH430>, and his laws<WH8451>.
And Moses<WH4872>' father-in<WH2859>-law said<WH559> unto him<WH1697>, The thing that thou doest<WH6213> is not good<WH2896>.

Thou wilt surely<WH5034> wear away<WH5034>, both thou<WH5971>, and this people that is with thee<WH1697>: for the thing is too heavy<WH3515> for thee<WH3201>; thou art not able to perform it thyself alone<WH6213>.

Hearken <WH8085> now unto my voice<WH6963>, I will give thee counsel<WH3289>, and God<WH430> be<WH1961> with thee<WH5971>: be thou for the people to Godward<WH4136>, and bring<WH935> thou the causes<WH1697> unto God<WH430>:

and thou shalt teach<WH2094> them the statutes<WH2706> and the laws<WH8451>, and shalt show<WH3045> them the way<WH1870> wherein they must walk<WH3212>, and the work<WH4639> that they must do<WH6213>.

Moreover thou shalt provide<WH2372> out of all the people<WH5971> able<WH2428> men<WH582>, such as fear<WH3373> God<WH430>, men<WH582> of truth<WH571>, hating<WH8130> unjust gain<WH1215>; and place<WH7760> such over them<WH8269>, to be rulers of thousands<WH505>, rulers<WH8269> of hundreds<WH3967>, rulers<WH8269> of fifties<WH2572>, and rulers<WH8269> of tens<WH6235>:

and let them judge<WH8199> the people<WH5971> at all seasons<WH6256>: and it shall be<WH1419>, that every great matter<WH1697> they shall bring<WH935> unto thee<WH6996>, but every small matter<WH1697> they shall judge<WH8199> themselves<WH7043>: so shall it be easier for thyself<WH5375>, and they shall bear the burden with thee.

If thou shalt do<WH6213> this thing<WH1697>, and God<WH430> command<WH6680> thee so<WH3201>, then thou shalt be able to endure<WH5975>, and all this people<WH5971> also shall go<WH935> to their place<WH4725> in peace<WH7965>.
So Moses<WH4872> hearkened<WH8085> to the voice<WH6963> of his father-in<WH2859>-law, and did<WH6213> all that he had said<WH559>.

And Moses<WH4872> chose<WH977> able<WH2428> men<WH582> out of all Israel<WH3478>, and made<WH5414> them heads<WH7218> over the people<WH5971>, rulers<WH8269> of thousands<WH505>, rulers<WH8269> of hundreds<WH3967>, rulers<WH8269> of fifties<WH2572>, and rulers<WH8269> of tens<WH6235>.

And they judged<WH8199> the people<WH5971> at all seasons<WH6256>: the hard<WH7186> causes<WH1697> they brought<WH935> unto Moses<WH4872>, but every small<WH6996> matter<WH1697> they judged themselves<WH8199>.
And Moses<WH4872> let his father-in<WH2859>-law depart<WH7971>; and he went<WH3212> his way into his own land<WH776>.
